column5: Health insurer Humana Inc   which is being bought by rival Aetna Inc   on Wednesday said that it had set aside 74 cents per share in the fourth quarter to cover anticipated shortfalls in its 2016 individual health plan business.

column4: Health insurer Humana's quarterly revenue rises
column5: Feb 10 Health insurer Humana Inc  which is being bought by rival Aetna Inc  reported an 8.4 percent rise in quarterly total revenue  helped by strength in its Medicare Advantage business.

column4: Central banks can cut rates well below zero  says JP Morgan
column5: LONDON Investors fretting about the damaging impact of ultra-cheap money on banks and global markets may need to prepare for key interest rates around the world falling well below zero  according to economists at JP Morgan.

column4: N.Y. governor urges U.S. to block KeyCorp-First Niagara merger
column5: NEW YORK New York Governor Andrew Cuomo on Wednesday urged federal regulators to block KeyCorp's  plan to acquire First Niagara Financial Group Inc   saying the merger would impede retail banking competition and cost thousands of jobs upstate.

column5: TORONTO Kinross Gold Corp   squeezed by slumping prices and production declines  expects to shake off a money-losing 2015 with record output and lower costs this year  the world's fifth-largest producer by output said on Wednesday.

column4: Miner Kinross reports bigger loss as production and prices drop
column5: TORONTO  Feb 10 Kinross Gold Corp  reported a bigger quarterly loss on Wednesday  as lower production and an ongoing slump in prices for the precious metal hurt the world's fifth-biggest producer by output.

column4: UK could restart Lloyds sale soon if price rises  official says
column5: LONDON  Feb 10 Britain's government could rapidly restart sales of state-held shares in Lloyds Banking Group if market conditions normalise and the share price rises  the finance ministry's top civil servant  Nicholas Macpherson  said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Pentagon expects to reach $15 bln F-35 deal with Lockheed in March
column5: WASHINGTON  Feb 10 The Pentagon on Wednesday said it expects to reach agreement with Lockheed Martin Corp  in March on contracts for the next two batches of F-35 fighter jets  orders worth about a combined $15 billion that will lower the cost of each warplane to below $100 million.

column4: Pentagon expects to reach $15 bln F-35 deal with Lockheed in March

column4: UPDATE 2-Pentagon to spend $56.3 bln for 404 Lockheed F-35 jets through FY21
column5: WASHINGTON  Feb 9 The U.S. Defense Department on Tuesday proposed spending $56.3 billion to buy 404 Lockheed Martin Corp F-35 fighter jets over the next five years  with fewer-than-expected orders slowing the anticipated production ramp for the new jets.

column4: U.S. tests find low cancer risk from Lumber Liquidators' flooring
column5: Government tests show some types of laminate flooring sold by Lumber Liquidators Holdings LLC can cause irritation and breathing problems but the risk of cancer from exposure is low  a federal agency said on Wednesday.

column5: Morgan Stanley's Raj Dhanda  head of investment products and services in the wealth management business  is leaving the Wall Street bank after 26 years.

column5: HELSINKI Finnish telecoms network equipment maker Nokia  on Wednesday said it holds about 91 percent of the shares in France's Alcatel-Lucent  following the second round of its 15.6 billion euro ($17.6 billion) all-stock offer.

column4: Nomura CEO aims to finally crack U.S. with shift to M&A advisory
column5: TOKYO Nomura Holdings Inc  plans a shift in focus in the United States toward client-oriented services from market-based trading  the chief executive said  in its latest attempt to establish a profitable business in a major overseas economy.

column4: CP to seek shareholder support for Norfolk takeover talks
column5: Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd  said on Tuesday it planned to seek support from Norfolk Southern Corp's  shareholders to push the U.S. railroad's board to engage in takeover talks.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-Futures point to higher start as oil prices recover
column5: Feb 10 Stock futures pointed to a higher start for Canada's main stock index on Wednesday as oil prices recovered due to the prospect of OPEC and other major producers cooperating to tackle a supply glut.

column4: UPDATE 3-CP to seek shareholder support for Norfolk takeover talks
column5: Feb 9 Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd said on Tuesday it planned to seek support from Norfolk Southern Corp's shareholders to push the U.S. railroad's board to engage in takeover talks.

column4: Petrobras international investors consider lawsuit in Netherlands
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Feb 10 A group of international investors and law firms are seeking compensation from Brazil's state-led oil company Petrobras under European law for losses allegedly suffered as the result of a giant price-fixing  bribery and political kickback scandal.

column4: Buffett's Berkshire buys $1 billion worth of Phillips 66 stock in 2016
column5: Berkshire Hathaway Inc  has bought an additional $1 billion of stock in Phillips 66  this year  and now owns roughly 14.1 percent of the oil refiner.

column4: Time Warner revenue falls on lack of hit movies
column5: Feb 10 Time Warner Inc  the owner of cable channels CNN  HBO and Cartoon Network  reported a 6 percent fall in quarterly revenue  hurt by a lack of hit movie releases in the period from its Warner Bros studio.

column4: CORRECTED-Twitter to change homepage to customize tweet displays to individuals
column5: Feb 10 Twitter Inc made a dramatic product change on Wednesday  saying it will recast the way it displays tweets on its homepage by customizing them to individual users  instead of uniformly displaying tweets in reverse chronological order.
